abstract: Open-ended questions require a more descriptive response than do closed-ended questions. Questions of this type can be broken down into categories that identify the format and content of the expected response. Accurate classification of open-ended questions can lead to more appropriate responses from question-answering systems and other intelligent systems â€“ leading to better human/computer interaction. This paper demonstrates how support vector machines (SVM) are used successfully in the classification of open-ended questions.
